ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right single-sided deafness (SSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of right acoustic neuroma removal 15 years ago; audiometry confirms anacusis in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports recent decline; audiometry shows slight SNHL at 250 Hz, normal mid-frequencies, sloping to moderate SNHL at 6000-8000 Hz.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds in both ears given the history of SSD and reported decline in the better ear.
To evaluate word recognition ability and validate pure-tone thresholds.
To evaluate the integrity of the auditory pathway.
To verify the hearing aid fitting in the left ear against prescriptive targets.
To verify the transparency of the CROS transmitter.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Diagnostic evaluation confirmed long-standing right anacusis and revealed a left mild-to-moderate high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss. Middle ear function was normal bilaterally. Speech recognition was excellent in the left ear but absent in the right.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: No measurable hearing (anacusis). Left ear: Slight SNHL at 250 Hz, normal 500-2000 Hz, sloping to moderate SNHL at 6000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left SRT 15 dB HL, WRS 100% at 45 dB SL. Right SRT and WRS: No response.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal middle ear function bilaterally (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsi/contra absent. Left ipsi normal 500-4000 Hz. Left contra present at 1000 Hz, absent/elevated elsewhere.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Fitting of Phonak BICROS system. Verification ensured appropriate gain for the left ear hearing loss and transparency of the CROS transmitter.

tests.name: Real-ear measurements (REM)
tests.result_summary: Verified fit of Phonak Audeo S Smart III (Left) using NAL-NL1 targets; measurements showed appropriate gain and smooth frequency response.

tests.name: Electroacoustic Analysis
tests.result_summary: Transparency verification: Output with CROS transmitter ON (95.2 dB SPL) showed similar frequency response to hearing aid alone (89.6 dB SPL).

proposed_items: Fit Phonak BICROS system (Phonak Audeo S Smart III on left, CROS transmitter on right)
Use open dome for left ear fitting
counseling_actions: Discussed amplification options for UHL including TransEar, AOIS, SoundBite, and BICROS
Explained that BICROS routes sound from the poorer ear to the better ear but does not restore binaural hearing or localization
Counseled that noise from the right side will be routed to the left ear, which can be distracting
Advised that the device will amplify high frequencies in the better ear to improve clarity
Discussed realistic expectations regarding localization and speech in noise

escalation.rationale_short: Patient has known stable right SSD and manageable left SNHL; routine follow-up for device maintenance and hearing monitoring.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds in the better ear and ensure continued benefit from the BICROS device.

expected_outcome: Patient reports the Phonak left BICROS is very beneficial and uses it regularly.
Patient asks for repetition less often and can converse with speakers on her right side.
Patient reports less fatigue in noisy environments, though localization difficulty persists.
